Building A Blog Website🌏 Based on Hugo the hugo-PaperMod theme.
Site demo:
…
Installing hugo Follow Hugo Docs’s - Quick Start guide to install Hugo.
macOS brew install hugo Windows scoop install hugo-extended Git must be installed as well.
Creating a site Execute the following command in the terminal. It will create the directory structure for your project in the blogwebsite directory.
hugo new site blogwebsite --format yaml Installing PaperMod Theme Themes reside in blogwebsite/themes directory. PaperMod will be installed in blogwebsite/themes/PaperMod cd blogwebsite git clone https://github.com/adityatelange/hugo-PaperMod themes/PaperMod --depth=1 Configuring the site: Edit the config file With the editor, open the site configuration file (hugo.yaml) in the root of the project.
# use vscode to edit the config file code . # or use (neo)vim vi hugo.yaml Make changes based on your own website information:
Set the baseURL for your production site. This value must begin with the protocol and end with a slash, as shown below. Set the title for your production site. baseURL: "https://<githubID>.github.io/" title: "My New Hugo Site" copyright: "© [name](url)" # 每页显示的内容条目数量 paginate: 5 theme: [PaperMod] enableInlineShortcodes: true enableRobotsTXT: true # 是否构建草稿/未来/过期文章。设置为false表示以上文章不会被构建和发布 buildDrafts: false buildFuture: false buildExpired: false enableEmoji: true pygmentsUseClasses: true mainsections: ["posts", "papermod"] # 配置压缩设置 minify: disableXML: true # minifyOutput: true menu: main: - name: Archive url: /archives/ weight: 5 - name: Search url: /search/ weight: 10 - name: Tags url: /tags/ weight: 10 # - name: WiKi # url: https://github.com/adityatelange/hugo-PaperMod/wiki/ outputs: home: - HTML - RSS - JSON params: env: production # to enable google analytics, opengraph, twitter-cards and schema. description: "Personal Blogs" author: <name> # author: ["Me", "You"] # multiple authors defaultTheme: auto # disableThemeToggle: true ShowShareButtons: true ShowReadingTime: true # disableSpecial1stPost: true displayFullLangName: true ShowPostNavLinks: true ShowBreadCrumbs: true ShowCodeCopyButtons: true ShowRssButtonInSectionTermList: true ShowAllPagesInArchive: true ShowPageNums: true ShowToc: true # comments: false # images: ["images/papermod-cover.png"] homeInfoParams: Title: "👋 Welcome to ..." Content: > Hi, this is .... I'm documenting my learning notes in this blog. socialIcons: - name: github title: View Source on Github url: "https://github.com/<id>/" - name: Discord title: Join discord community url: "https://discord.gg/<code>" # analytics: # google: # SiteVerificationTag: "XYZabc" assets: disableHLJS: true # 网站图标 favicon: "/favicon.ico" markup: goldmark: renderer: unsafe: true highlight: noClasses: false services: instagram: disableInlineCSS: true twitter: disableInlineCSS: true Set a Favicon for Your Site Download a Favicon: Visit the favicon website and download a favicon. Unzip the downloaded favicon file. Copy the favicon.ico icon and paste it into your project’s static directory at /websiteblog/static/favicon.ico. Modify the baseof.html File: Copy the /websiteblog/themes/PaperMod/layouts/_default/baseof.html file, maintaining the directory structure. Paste it into your project directory at /websiteblog/layouts/_default/baseof.html. Modify the baseof.html file as shown below: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="{{ site.Language }}" dir="{{ .Language.LanguageDirection | default "auto" }}"> <head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> <title>{{ .Title }}</title> <!-- Favicon links --> <link rel="icon" type="image/x-icon" href="{{ .Site.Params.assets.favicon }}"> {{- partial "head.html" . }} </head> Adding two markdown files touch /content/archives.md /content/search.md archives.md:
--- title: "Archive" layout: "archives" url: "/archives/" summary: archives --- search.md:
--- title: "Search" placeholder: "Search the site..." layout: "search" --- Ensure that your project structure looks like this Let’s see what the website looks like: # At the blogwebsite dir hugo server # paste localhost:1313 into the browser Adding content to the BlogWebsite Add a new page to your site.
hugo new content posts/my-first-post.md Hugo created the file in the content/posts directory. Open the file with your editor.
+++ title = 'My First Post' date = 2024-01-14T07:07:07+01:00 draft = true +++ ## Introduction This is **bold** text, and this is *emphasized* text. Visit the [Hugo](https://gohugo.io) website! Notice the draft value in the front matter is true. By default, Hugo does not publish draft content when you build the site. Learn more about draft, future, and expired content.
Add some Markdown to the body of the post. When satisfied with your new content, set the front matter draft parameter to false. And run the command:
hugo Deploying the Website Initialize a Git Repository:
Navigate to the project’spublic directory.
Initialize a git repository if you haven’t already:
git init Commit Your Changes:
Add all your files to the repository and Commit the changes
git add . git commit -m "Initial commit" Create a GitHub Repository:
Go to GitHub and create a new repository. Do not initialize the repository with a README, .gitignore, or license file. Push Your Local Repository to GitHub:
Link your local repository to the GitHub repository you just created:
git remote add origin https://github.com/yourusername/yourrepositoryname.git Push your changes to the GitHub repository:
git push -u origin main Configure GitHub Pages:
Go to the repository settings on GitHub. Scroll down to the “GitHub Pages” section. Under “Source,” select the main branch and the /root folder.
